body:
/kind bug

**What happened**:
`kubectl get nodes` doesn't show role
```
kubectl get nodes -o wide
NAME                                           STATUS    AGE       VERSION   EXTERNAL-IP      OS-IMAGE                      KERNEL-VERSION
ip-172-20-101-111.eu-west-1.compute.internal   Ready     23h       v1.7.0    X.X.X.X          Debian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie)   4.4.65-k8s
ip-172-20-101-122.eu-west-1.compute.internal   Ready     23h       v1.7.0    X.X.X.X          Debian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie)   4.4.65-k8s
ip-172-20-48-148.eu-west-1.compute.internal    Ready     23h       v1.7.0    X.X.X.X          Debian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie)   4.4.65-k8s
ip-172-20-63-150.eu-west-1.compute.internal    Ready     23h       v1.7.0    X.X.X.X          Debian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie)   4.4.65-k8s
ip-172-20-68-226.eu-west-1.compute.internal    Ready     23h       v1.7.0    X.X.X.X          Debian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie)   4.4.65-k8s
ip-172-20-79-207.eu-west-1.compute.internal    Ready     23h       v1.7.0    X.X.X.X          Debian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie)   4.4.65-k8s
```

Workaround:
```
kubectl get nodes --selector=kubernetes.io/role=master
NAME                                           STATUS    AGE       VERSION
ip-172-20-101-122.eu-west-1.compute.internal   Ready     23h       v1.7.0
ip-172-20-48-148.eu-west-1.compute.internal    Ready     23h       v1.7.0
ip-172-20-79-207.eu-west-1.compute.internal    Ready     23h       v1.7.0

kubectl get nodes --selector=kubernetes.io/role=node
NAME                                           STATUS    AGE       VERSION
ip-172-20-101-111.eu-west-1.compute.internal   Ready     23h       v1.7.0
ip-172-20-63-150.eu-west-1.compute.internal    Ready     23h       v1.7.0
ip-172-20-68-226.eu-west-1.compute.internal    Ready     23h       v1.7.0
```
**What you expected to happen**:
According to #35901 and https://github.com/heptio/aws-quickstart/issues/61
```
kubectl get nodes
NAME                                           STATUS           AGE       VERSION
ip-172-20-101-111.eu-west-1.compute.internal   Ready,node       23h       v1.7.0
ip-172-20-101-122.eu-west-1.compute.internal   Ready,master     23h       v1.7.0
ip-172-20-48-148.eu-west-1.compute.internal    Ready,master     23h       v1.7.0
ip-172-20-63-150.eu-west-1.compute.internal    Ready,node       23h       v1.7.0
ip-172-20-68-226.eu-west-1.compute.internal    Ready,node       23h       v1.7.0
ip-172-20-79-207.eu-west-1.compute.internal    Ready,master     23h       v1.7.0
```

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
I just deployed a multi master kubernetes environment with kops:
```
kops create cluster --target terraform --name example.com --zones eu-west-1a,eu-west-1b,eu-west-1c --master-zones eu-west-1a,eu-west-1b,eu-west-1c --master-size t2.micro --node-size t2.micro --node-count 3
cd out/terraform
terraform apply
```

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
kubectl version --short
Client Version: v1.7.2
Server Version: v1.7.0
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: AWS
- Install tools: kops, terraform
